Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh team director Khaled Mahmud Sujon has taken up Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka over his comments on the Bangladeshi bowling attack.
Sujon has hit back with a jibe “at least Bangladesh have 2” as the competition heats up in the Asia Cup.
Bangladesh team director Khaled Mahmud Sujon said that it is up to the Sri Lanka captain to express his opinions.
Sujon said that Bangladesh's batting needs to gel up and they need to score...not lose too many wickets in the powerplay, that's the key factor.
Sujon further added that if they can score at least 150, 160 runs, they have a good chance to win with their bowling.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka will hope to launch Wanindu Hasaranga on Bangladesh, who have exhibited weakness vs leg-spin.

Both teams were terrible against Afghanistan, with Sri Lanka unable to handle the early swing of Fazalhaq Farooqi, and Bangladesh losing their first six wickets to Afghanistan spin duo Mujeeb Ur Rahman and Rashid Khan.
Others: The war of words has begun between the two units of Bangladesh and Sri Lanka, who are set to face each other in a do-or-die game in Asia Cup on Thursday, 1 September.
